name: SpaceX Info API
description: Get Basic info of SpaceX Organisation

response.details: SpaceX's first east coast landing pad is Landing Zone 1, where the historic first Falcon 9 landing occurred in December 2015. LC-13 was originally used as a launch pad for early Atlas missiles and rockets from Lockheed Martin. LC-1 was later expanded to include Landing Zone 2 for side booster RTLS Falcon Heavy missions, and it was first used in February 2018 for that purpose.

SpaceX's first east coast landing pad is Landing Zone 1, where the historic first Falcon 9 landing occurred in December 2015. LC-13 was originally used as a launch pad for early Atlas missiles and rockets from Lockheed Martin. LC-1 was later expanded to include Landing Zone 2 for side booster RTLS Falcon Heavy missions, and it was first used in February 2018 for that purpose.

SpaceX's west coast landing pad. The pad is adjacent to SLC-4E, SpaceX's west coast launch site. The pad was under construction for about a year starting in 2016. After concerns with seal mating season, this pad was first used for the SAOCOM 1A mission in October 2018. Officially referred to as LZ-4 in FCC filings.
